fields.summary: Invalidation of connection object cache is non-deterministic

issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description: Occasionally, I am seeing images that I created in the 'eucalyptus' account in other accounts.  For example, I created an ubuntu image and a load-balancer image while logged into the eucalyptus account.  I then logged into an account called 'ccassler'.  When I logged into the account, I initially did not see any images.  I refreshed the images a few times and the 2 images I created from the other account appeared.  I then tried to launch an instance with the ubuntu image.  When I submit the image for launch, I get an Internal Server Error.  I have attached the stack trace to this bug.  This might be related to Bug 855.  I also attached a screenshot of the images showing up in the non-eucalyptus account.
fields.summary: Randomly seeing images from 'eucalyptus' account in other accounts

comments.body: I can confirm this. Using a single threaded server (waitress) instead of gunicorn with multiple workers, I limit the problem to a single set of image caches. An image created in a single account and not shared is being shown in another account. The cache key is images_cache_[]_[]_euca_90875 which reflects no owners or executors specified, euca region and process PID. This, unfortunately, is not unique to this user in any way, so we'll need to fix that. Good find!
This is still happening with today's build.
[~ccassler]: Please retest this after the fix for GUI-908 (at https://github.com/eucalyptus/eucaconsole/pull/662) is merged and is in the latest build.
[~ccassler], [~alice]: The fix for GUI-908 (pull request 662) has been merged into develop.
[~kgill] I tested it already on FF/MAC did not see the issue. The images were displaying correctly after I installed a new image with limited launch permissions.
I think this problem will be fixed by this other change. (GUI-921)
[~dkavanagh]: GUI-875 was fixed by the fix for GUI-908 AFAICT.
I do think GUI-921 relates, though GUI-908 more likely was a direct fix visible to users. GUI-921 removes caching altogether for the images that are the complaint in this bug
GUI-875 is most likely fixed by the fix for GUI-908
[~kgill], [~alice], [~dkavanagh]: I am no longer seeing this.  I tried to reproduce on both Chrome and FF browsers, I was unable to reproduce.

[~ccassler]: Ok thank you for confirming.  Good to know that the fix for GUI-908 appears to have fixed this one.  Also noting that GUI-921 isn't related to GUI-875, since 921 hasn't been merged into develop yet.
